alert.note: Alert for Bennett; Haakon; Jackson; Mellette; Todd (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 10:08PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Haakon, southeastern Oglala Lakota, western Todd, Mellette, Jackson and Bennett Counties through 1115 PM MDT/1215 AM CDT/... At 1008 PM MDT/1108 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles north of Kadoka to 3 miles southwest of Intersection of Highway 73 and White River to 7 miles south of Swett. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Kadoka and Intersection of Highway 73 and White River around 1015 PM MDT. Martin, Belvidere, Sunrise Housing and Lacreek Wildlife Refuge around 1020 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Tuthill, Harrington, Spring Creek, Saint Francis and Lakeview. This includes Interstate 90 in South Dakota between Mile Markers 135 and 174. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight MDT/100 AM CDT/ for southwestern South Dakota.
